intro: Gnaphalium dysodes, commonly known as the common cudweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches a height of about 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features small, clustered yellow flowers that are surrounded by pale green to white bracts. Its leaves are lance-shaped, hairy, and often have a bluish-gray appearance. Gnaphalium dysodes is native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa, and it thrives in a variety of habitats including meadows, roadsides, and disturbed soils.
